ğŸ§ª Testing Redis connection...
âŒ Redis module not installed

âš ï¸  Redis is not available
The application will use simple in-memory caching as fallback.

ğŸ’¡ Solutions:
1. Edit the configuration file:
   - Open config/redis_config.txt
   - Modify REDIS_SOCKET path for your server
   - Change CONNECTION_TYPE if needed

2. Common socket paths:
   - DirectAdmin: /home/username/.redis/redis.sock
   - cPanel: /home/username/.redis/redis.sock
   - VPS: /var/run/redis/redis.sock

3. For TCP connection:
   - Set CONNECTION_TYPE=tcp
   - Configure REDIS_HOST and REDIS_PORT

4. The application will automatically fall back to simple caching
   when Redis is not available (no action needed)

5. For DirectAdmin hosting:
   - Contact your hosting provider to enable Redis
   - Or use a managed Redis service (Redis Cloud, AWS ElastiCache, etc.)
